result.execSummary:
The defendant Dallas C Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs which includes repayment of $1,600 for buy money.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as determined by probation agent.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 30 days stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dallas C Reed

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of conviction - Court imposes 30 days of stayed conditiional jail time with huber privileges.
Expense sheet for buy money from Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force

Defendant Dallas C Reed in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Dallas C Reed in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives plea agreement. Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Defendant/Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea. Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders DNA sample.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dallas C Reed in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Clowers indicates matter is resolved, asks court to set a plea/sentencing date. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Dallas C Reed in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Attorney David R. Clowers in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions Atty Clowers on defendants whereabouts. Atty Clowers indicates he sent notice of rescheduled court date to defendant and tried calling her but her phone mailbox was full. Atty Clowers asks court to adjourn matter until Monday to allow him time to get in contact with defendant. State requests bench warrant but has no problem with court staying the signing of it until Monday. Court reschedules matter to 9/14/15 at 8:15 am. If defendant fails to appear on that day, court will be signing a bench warrant.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.
from Atty Clowers requesting the hearing scheduled for 8/24/15 be rescheduled because of a conflict. Court reschedules.

Defendant Dallas C Reed in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/29/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 3/03/16)

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to discuss case with B.R.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Dallas C Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Atty Gerbers indicates he has conflict, will have PD appoint counsel to represent defendant. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
